lead_paragraph: Atopic dermatitis causes itching so extreme that many patients consider suicide. In trials, most patients said symptoms waned in the first two weeks of taking a new drug.

headline.print_headline: 2 Trials Show New Treatment for Severe Eczema Can Provide Swift Relief
headline.main: New Drug for Severe Eczema Is Successful in 2 New Trials

snippet: Atopic dermatitis causes itching so extreme that many patients consider suicide. In trials, most patients said symptoms waned in the first two weeks of taking a new drug....
abstract: Results of two large clinical trials of drug dupilumab, developed to treat uncontrolled, moderate-to-severe atopic dermatitis, type of eczema, are published in New England Journal of Medicine; trials show promising results, with some patients experiencing instantaneous relief from itching that can sometimes be so unbearable patients consider suicide.
